trans-unit.source: How to Map Content Delivery Network (CDN) Content to a Custom Domain
trans-unit.target: How to Map Content Delivery Network (CDN) Content to a Custom Domain

trans-unit.source: This topic demonstrate how to map a CDN content to a Custom Domain.
trans-unit.target: This topic demonstrate how to map a CDN content to a Custom Domain.

trans-unit.source: How to map Custom Domain to Content Delivery Network (CDN) endpoint
trans-unit.target: How to map Custom Domain to Content Delivery Network (CDN) endpoint

trans-unit.source: You can map a custom domain to a CDN endpoint in order to use your own domain name in URLs to cached content, rather than using the CDN endpoint provided to you.
trans-unit.target: You can map a custom domain to a CDN endpoint in order to use your own domain name in URLs to cached content, rather than using the CDN endpoint provided to you.

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to map your custom domain to a CDN endpoint.
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to map your custom domain to a CDN endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Create a CNAME record with your domain registrar and map your custom domain and subdomain to the CDN endpoint
trans-unit.target: Create a CNAME record with your domain registrar and map your custom domain and subdomain to the CDN endpoint

trans-unit.source: A CNAME record is a DNS feature that maps a source domain to a destination domain.
trans-unit.target: A CNAME record is a DNS feature that maps a source domain to a destination domain.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the source domain is your custom domain and subdomain (subdomain is always required).
trans-unit.target: In this case, the source domain is your custom domain and subdomain (subdomain is always required).

trans-unit.source: The destination domain is your CDN endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The destination domain is your CDN endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The process of mapping your custom domain to your CDN endpoint can, however, result in a brief period of downtime for the domain while you are registering the domain in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: The process of mapping your custom domain to your CDN endpoint can, however, result in a brief period of downtime for the domain while you are registering the domain in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Add an intermediate registration step with Azure cdnverify
trans-unit.target: Add an intermediate registration step with Azure cdnverify

trans-unit.source: If your custom domain is currently supporting an application with a service-level agreement (SLA) that requires that there be no downtime, then you can use the Azure **cdnverify** subdomain to provide an intermediate registration step so that users will be able to access your domain while the DNS mapping takes place.
trans-unit.target: If your custom domain is currently supporting an application with a service-level agreement (SLA) that requires that there be no downtime, then you can use the Azure **cdnverify** subdomain to provide an intermediate registration step so that users will be able to access your domain while the DNS mapping takes place.

trans-unit.source: AZURE.NOTE
trans-unit.target: AZURE.NOTE

trans-unit.source: You must create a CNAME record with your domain registrar to map your domain to the CDN endpoint.
trans-unit.target: You must create a CNAME record with your domain registrar to map your domain to the CDN endpoint.

trans-unit.source: CNAME records map specific subdomains such as www.mydomain.com or myblog.mydomain.com.
trans-unit.target: CNAME records map specific subdomains such as www.mydomain.com or myblog.mydomain.com.

trans-unit.source: It is not possible to map a CNAME record to a root domain, such as mydomain.com.
trans-unit.target: It is not possible to map a CNAME record to a root domain, such as mydomain.com.

trans-unit.source: A subdomain can only be associated with one CDN endpoint.
trans-unit.target: A subdomain can only be associated with one CDN endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The CNAME record that you create will route all traffic addressed to the subdomain to the specified endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The CNAME record that you create will route all traffic addressed to the subdomain to the specified endpoint.

trans-unit.source: E.g.
trans-unit.target: E.g.

trans-unit.source: If you associate www.mydomain.com with your CDN endpoint, then you cannot associate it with other Azure endpoints, such as a storage account endpoint or a cloud service endpoint.
trans-unit.target: If you associate www.mydomain.com with your CDN endpoint, then you cannot associate it with other Azure endpoints, such as a storage account endpoint or a cloud service endpoint.

trans-unit.source: However, you can use different subdomains from the same domain for different service endpoints.
trans-unit.target: However, you can use different subdomains from the same domain for different service endpoints.

trans-unit.source: You can also map different subdomains to the same CDN endpoint.
trans-unit.target: You can also map different subdomains to the same CDN endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The procedures in this topic will show you how to:
trans-unit.target: The procedures in this topic will show you how to:

trans-unit.source: Register a custom domain for an Azure CDN endpoint
trans-unit.target: Register a custom domain for an Azure CDN endpoint

trans-unit.source: Register a custom domain for an Azure CDN endpoint using the intermediary cdnverify subdomain
trans-unit.target: Register a custom domain for an Azure CDN endpoint using the intermediary cdnverify subdomain

trans-unit.source: Verify that the custom subdomain references your CDN endpoint
trans-unit.target: Verify that the custom subdomain references your CDN endpoint

trans-unit.source: Register a custom domain for an Azure CDN endpoint
trans-unit.target: Register a custom domain for an Azure CDN endpoint

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/).

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, click **CDN**.
trans-unit.target: In the navigation pane, click **CDN**.

trans-unit.source: From the list view, click the name of the CDN endpoint with which you want to associate the subdomain, to navigate to the detail page for that endpoint.
trans-unit.target: From the list view, click the name of the CDN endpoint with which you want to associate the subdomain, to navigate to the detail page for that endpoint.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click **Manage Domains** to display the **Manage custom domains** dialog box.
trans-unit.target: On the ribbon, click **Manage Domains** to display the **Manage custom domains** dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the text of the dialog box, you'll see the host name, derived from your CDN endpoint, to use in creating a new CNAME record.
trans-unit.target: In the text of the dialog box, you'll see the host name, derived from your CDN endpoint, to use in creating a new CNAME record.

trans-unit.source: The format of the host name address will appear as **az#####.vo.msecnd.net** (where **az#####** is the identifier for your CDN endpoint).
trans-unit.target: The format of the host name address will appear as **az#####.vo.msecnd.net** (where **az#####** is the identifier for your CDN endpoint).

trans-unit.source: You can copy this host name to use in creating the CNAME record.
trans-unit.target: You can copy this host name to use in creating the CNAME record.

trans-unit.source: For this procedure, ignore the text that refers to the **cdnverify** subdomain.
trans-unit.target: For this procedure, ignore the text that refers to the **cdnverify** subdomain.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your domain registrar's web site, and locate the section for creating DNS records.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your domain registrar's web site, and locate the section for creating DNS records.

trans-unit.source: You might find this in a section such as **Domain Name**, **DNS**, or **Name Server Management**.
trans-unit.target: You might find this in a section such as **Domain Name**, **DNS**, or **Name Server Management**.

trans-unit.source: Find the section for managing CNAMEs.
trans-unit.target: Find the section for managing CNAMEs.

trans-unit.source: You may have to go to an advanced settings page and look for the words CNAME, Alias, or Subdomains.
trans-unit.target: You may have to go to an advanced settings page and look for the words CNAME, Alias, or Subdomains.

trans-unit.source: Create a new CNAME record that maps your chosen subdomain (for example, **www** or **cdn**) to the host name provided in the **Manage custom domains** dialog.
trans-unit.target: Create a new CNAME record that maps your chosen subdomain (for example, **www** or **cdn**) to the host name provided in the **Manage custom domains** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Return to the **Manage custom domains** dialog, and enter your custom domain, including the subdomain, in the dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Return to the **Manage custom domains** dialog, and enter your custom domain, including the subdomain, in the dialog box.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter the domain name in the format www.mydomain.com or cdn.mydomain.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter the domain name in the format www.mydomain.com or cdn.mydomain.com.

trans-unit.source: Azure will verify that the CNAME record exists for the domain name you have entered.
trans-unit.target: Azure will verify that the CNAME record exists for the domain name you have entered.

trans-unit.source: If the CNAME is correct, your custom domain is validated and ready to use with your CDN content.
trans-unit.target: If the CNAME is correct, your custom domain is validated and ready to use with your CDN content.

trans-unit.source: Note that in some cases it can take time for the CNAME record to propagate to name servers on the Internet.
trans-unit.target: Note that in some cases it can take time for the CNAME record to propagate to name servers on the Internet.

trans-unit.source: If your domain is not validated immediately, and you believe the CNAME record is correct, then wait a few minutes and try again.
trans-unit.target: If your domain is not validated immediately, and you believe the CNAME record is correct, then wait a few minutes and try again.

trans-unit.source: Register a custom domain for an Azure CDN endpoint using the intermediary cdnverify subdomain
trans-unit.target: Register a custom domain for an Azure CDN endpoint using the intermediary cdnverify subdomain

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/).
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Management Portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com/).

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, click **CDN**.
trans-unit.target: In the navigation pane, click **CDN**.

trans-unit.source: From the list view, click the name of the CDN endpoint with which you want to associate the subdomain, to navigate to the detail page for that endpoint.
trans-unit.target: From the list view, click the name of the CDN endpoint with which you want to associate the subdomain, to navigate to the detail page for that endpoint.

trans-unit.source: On the ribbon, click **Manage Domains** to display the **Manage custom domains** dialog box.
trans-unit.target: On the ribbon, click **Manage Domains** to display the **Manage custom domains** dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the text of the dialog box, you'll see the host name, derived from your CDN endpoint, to use in creating a new CNAME record using the **cdnverify** intermediary subdomain.
trans-unit.target: In the text of the dialog box, you'll see the host name, derived from your CDN endpoint, to use in creating a new CNAME record using the **cdnverify** intermediary subdomain.

trans-unit.source: The format of the host name address will appear as **cdnverify.az#####.vo.msecnd.net**.
trans-unit.target: The format of the host name address will appear as **cdnverify.az#####.vo.msecnd.net**.

trans-unit.source: You can copy this host name to use in creating the CNAME record.
trans-unit.target: You can copy this host name to use in creating the CNAME record.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your domain registrar's web site, and locate the section for creating DNS records.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your domain registrar's web site, and locate the section for creating DNS records.

trans-unit.source: You might find this in a section such as **Domain Name**, **DNS**, or **Name Server Management**.
trans-unit.target: You might find this in a section such as **Domain Name**, **DNS**, or **Name Server Management**.

trans-unit.source: Find the section for managing CNAMEs.
trans-unit.target: Find the section for managing CNAMEs.

trans-unit.source: You may have to go to an advanced settings page and look for the words **CNAME**, **Alias**, or **Subdomains**.
trans-unit.target: You may have to go to an advanced settings page and look for the words **CNAME**, **Alias**, or **Subdomains**.

trans-unit.source: Create a new CNAME record, and provide a subdomain alias that includes the **cdnverify** subdomain.
trans-unit.target: Create a new CNAME record, and provide a subdomain alias that includes the **cdnverify** subdomain.

trans-unit.source: For example, the subdomain that you specify will be in the format **cdnverify.www** or **cdnverify.cdn**.
trans-unit.target: For example, the subdomain that you specify will be in the format **cdnverify.www** or **cdnverify.cdn**.

trans-unit.source: Then provide the host name, which is your CDN endpoint, in the format **cdnverify.az#####.vo.msecnd.net** (where **az#####** is the identifier for your CDN endpoint).
trans-unit.target: Then provide the host name, which is your CDN endpoint, in the format **cdnverify.az#####.vo.msecnd.net** (where **az#####** is the identifier for your CDN endpoint).

trans-unit.source: The format of the host name is provided for you in the **Manage custom domains** dialog.
trans-unit.target: The format of the host name is provided for you in the **Manage custom domains** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Return to the **Manage custom domains** dialog, and enter your custom domain, including the subdomain, in the dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Return to the **Manage custom domains** dialog, and enter your custom domain, including the subdomain, in the dialog box.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter the domain name in the format **www.mydomain.com** or **cdn.mydomain.com**.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter the domain name in the format **www.mydomain.com** or **cdn.mydomain.com**.

trans-unit.source: Note that in this step, you do not need to preface the subdomain with **cdnverify**.
trans-unit.target: Note that in this step, you do not need to preface the subdomain with **cdnverify**.

trans-unit.source: Azure will verify that the CNAME record exists for the cdnverify domain name you have entered.
trans-unit.target: Azure will verify that the CNAME record exists for the cdnverify domain name you have entered.

trans-unit.source: At this point, your custom domain has been verified by Azure, but traffic to your domain is not yet being routed to your CDN endpoint.
trans-unit.target: At this point, your custom domain has been verified by Azure, but traffic to your domain is not yet being routed to your CDN endpoint.

trans-unit.source: To complete the process, return to your DNS registrar's web site, and create another CNAME record that maps your subdomain to your CDN endpoint.
trans-unit.target: To complete the process, return to your DNS registrar's web site, and create another CNAME record that maps your subdomain to your CDN endpoint.

trans-unit.source: For example, specify the subdomain as **www** or **cdn**, and the hostname as **az#####.vo.msecnd.net**.
trans-unit.target: For example, specify the subdomain as **www** or **cdn**, and the hostname as **az#####.vo.msecnd.net**.

trans-unit.source: With this step, the registration of your custom domain is complete.
trans-unit.target: With this step, the registration of your custom domain is complete.

trans-unit.source: Finally, you can delete the CNAME record you created using **cdnverify**, as it was necessary only as an intermediary step.
trans-unit.target: Finally, you can delete the CNAME record you created using **cdnverify**, as it was necessary only as an intermediary step.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the custom subdomain references your CDN endpoint
trans-unit.target: Verify that the custom subdomain references your CDN endpoint

trans-unit.source: After you have completed the registration of your custom domain, you can access content that is cached at your CDN endpoint using the custom domain.
trans-unit.target: After you have completed the registration of your custom domain, you can access content that is cached at your CDN endpoint using the custom domain.

trans-unit.source: First, ensure that you have public content that is cached at the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: First, ensure that you have public content that is cached at the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your CDN endpoint is associated with a storage account, the CDN caches content in public blob containers.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your CDN endpoint is associated with a storage account, the CDN caches content in public blob containers.

trans-unit.source: To test the custom domain, ensure that your container is set to allow public access and that it contains at least one blob.
trans-unit.target: To test the custom domain, ensure that your container is set to allow public access and that it contains at least one blob.

trans-unit.source: In your browser, navigate to the address of the blob using the custom domain.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, navigate to the address of the blob using the custom domain.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your custom domain is **www.mydomain.com**, the URL to a cached blob will be similar to the following URL:
trans-unit.target: For example, if your custom domain is **www.mydomain.com**, the URL to a cached blob will be similar to the following URL:

trans-unit.source: If your CDN endpoint is associated with a cloud service, then the address of your cached content will be similar to the following URL:
trans-unit.target: If your CDN endpoint is associated with a cloud service, then the address of your cached content will be similar to the following URL:

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.source: How to Enable the Content Delivery Network (CDN) for Azure
trans-unit.target: How to Enable the Content Delivery Network (CDN) for Azure

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
